item.title: Google Wants Your TV to Know When You're In the Room - CNET
item.description:
Google Wants Your TV to Know When You're In the Room

Publication Date: January 6, 2025
Source: CNET

Google has unveiled a new ambient mode for Google TV devices that allows them to detect when a person enters a room and display relevant information like news and weather without any input from the user.

  • The new feature was demonstrated at CES 2025.
  • The TVs will use radar-like technology to sense motion instead of cameras, prioritizing privacy and cost.
  • Existing presence detection features offered by competitors like Amazon and Sony are noted.
  • Google aims to make its TVs more of a living room hub, enhanced by AI upgrades with Gemini models.
"Our vision is that this can be something so much more," - Jamieson Brettle, Google product manager.

The upcoming Google TV products that support this feature are expected to launch later this year.

item.title: Global HMPV Tracker: Tamil Nadu Detects 2 Cases, India's Tally Rises To 5 - NDTV
item.description:
Tamil Nadu Reports First Cases of HMPV, Nationwide Tally Reaches 5

Publication Date: January 6, 2025 | Source: NDTV

Five cases of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) have been confirmed in India, with the first instances reported in Tamil Nadu. The government is monitoring the situation as concerns rise about the respiratory virus.

The following are key points from the article:

  • Two cases identified in Tamil Nadu, one each in Chennai and Salem.
  • A three-month-old baby has been discharged from the hospital, and an eight-month-old is recovering.
  • HMPV has no travel exposure links, according to health officials.
  • Guidelines reminiscent of Covid-19 protocols are issued in several states for preparedness.
  • Health experts stress that HMPV is not a new virus but has been circulating globally.
“HMPV is not a new virus. It was first identified in 2001 and has been circulating worldwide.” - Union Health Minister JP Nadda

The health ministry assures that monitoring is ongoing and the public should remain calm while following the recommended precautions.

item.title: "Everything was fine when Rahul Dravid was there": Harbhajan Singh suprised by Team India's downfall under Gautam Gambhir - Crictoday
item.description:
“Everything was fine when Rahul Dravid was there”: Harbhajan Singh suprised by Team India’s downfall under Gautam Gambhir

Publication Date: [Insert Publication Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

Former India spinner Harbhajan Singh questioned the team’s decline following Rahul Dravid's tenure as head coach. India recently lost the Border-Gavaskar Trophy to Australia by a score of 1-3, marking a significant downturn since Dravid's departure.

  • India celebrated success under Dravid, winning the ICC T20 World Cup 2024.
  • Gautam Gambhir took over as head coach but has seen disappointing results since.
  • India lost their ODI series against Sri Lanka (0-2) and struggled in Test series against New Zealand (0-3).
  • Harbhajan Singh advocates for selecting players based on current form, criticizing reliance on past reputations.
  • Notable struggles from key players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in recent series.
“In the past six months, we lost to Sri Lanka, New Zealand and Australia. Everything was fine till Rahul Dravid was our coach. We won the T20 World Cup and everything was looking good.”

The commentary from Harbhajan highlights the urgency for the selectors to move away from a “superstar culture” and focus on deserving players.

item.title: 10 striking images of galaxies captured by NASA - DNA India
item.description:
10 Striking Images of Galaxies Captured by NASA

Date: Jan 6, 2025 Source: DNA

This article features breathtaking images captured by NASA showing various galaxies, highlighting their beauty and uniqueness across the universe.

  • The bright spiral galaxy MCG-01-24-014 located about 275 million light-years from Earth.
  • The spiral galaxy IC 5332, around 30 million light-years away.
  • The tranquil spiral galaxy UGC 12295, observed by Hubble.
  • The jellyfish galaxy JO206, with star formation visible.
  • A galaxy in Pisces displaying extraordinary structures around a supermassive black hole.
  • A barred spiral galaxy that has hosted three supernovae since 1992.
  • Caldwell 5 galaxy located in the Camelopardalis constellation.
“Source: NASA”

These images offer a glimpse into the vastness of space and the stunning formations of galaxies, showcasing the ongoing exploration and observation of the cosmos.

item.title: HMPV not new virus in India: Health Ministry says as cases detected - The Hindu
item.description:
HMPV Not a New Virus in India, Health Ministry Clarifies Amid Cases

Published on: January 06, 2025 by The Hindu

The Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) is already in circulation globally, including in India, with cases reported but no alarming increase according to the Health Ministry. Health experts assure that the virus is not new and precautions are necessary.

  • The HMPV has been circulating since its identification in 2001.
  • Current cases in India do not involve individuals with travel history.
  • Health systems remain vigilant without significant risk to the public.
  • Precautions similar to those for common cold are recommended.
  • Health Departments are monitoring and issuing advisories to handle potential spread.
“It’s a known virus that causes respiratory infections, mostly mild.” - Soumya Swaminathan, former chief scientist, WHO

Overall, there is no reason for panic as the health systems are managing the situation effectively.

item.title: Game Changer: 2 Fans Die After Attending Ram Charan Film's Pre-Release Event; Dil Raju Offers Rs10-Lakh Aid - News18
item.description:
Game Changer: 2 Fans Die After Attending Ram Charan Film's Pre-Release Event; Dil Raju Offers Rs10-Lakh Aid

Date: January 06, 2025 Source: News18

Two Ram Charan fans tragically lost their lives after attending the film's pre-release event in Rajahmundry. The families will receive financial assistance from the producer Dil Raju.

  • The victims were identified as Arava Manikanta (23) and Thokada Charan (22).
  • They were involved in a fatal accident on their way home after the event.
  • Dil Raju has pledged Rs 10 lakh to support the families affected.
  • Pawan Kalyan also promised Rs 5 lakh each to the victims’ families.
  • This incident follows another tragic event where a woman died at a Pushpa 2 screening.
“I pray that their souls rest in peace, and we will stand by and support the two families.” - Dil Raju

This sorrowful event highlights the dangers associated with large public gatherings and the importance of ensuring safety for all attendees.

item.description:
Single Cell Genomics Market Research Report 2025 with Executive and Consultant Guides, & Profiles of 55+ Companies

Date: Jan. 06, 2025 Source: GLOBE NEWSWIRE

This report provides comprehensive insights into the Single Cell Genomics market, showcasing emerging trends and potential applications within the healthcare sector.

  • Single Cell Genomics is revolutionizing scientific research and offers new opportunities in biotechnology.
  • Market dynamics are influenced by advancements in immuno-oncology and the convergence of technology sectors.
  • Challenges include intense competition and technological limitations impacting diagnostics.
  • Recent developments highlight significant innovations from key industry players.
“The sky just might be the limit on this new approach to capturing genetic information.”

This report highlights critical developments in the Single Cell Genomics field and offers valuable insights for stakeholders in the market.

item.title: ULTRALOQ Unveils Innovative Smart Locks at CES 2025: Bolt Mission UWB + NFC And Bolt Fingerprint Matter - Ubergizmo
item.description:
ULTRALOQ Unveils Innovative Smart Locks at CES 2025: Bolt Mission UWB + NFC And Bolt Fingerprint Matter

Date: January 2025

Source: Ubergizmo

ULTRALOQ introduces two cutting-edge smart locks at CES 2025, enhancing home security through innovative technology and smart home integration.

  • The ULTRALOQ Bolt Mission UWB + NFC is the first smart lock with ultra-wideband technology, offering precise location detection for automatic unlocking.
  • This lock supports NFC for easy access and integrates with smart home systems via Matter, compatible with various voice assistants.
  • The Bolt Fingerprint Matter allows multiple access methods, including app control, fingerprint recognition, and voice commands, with the ability to share digital keys.
  • Both locks boast weather-resistant designs and long battery life, with the Bolt Mission priced at $399 and the Bolt Fingerprint at $199.
“By pioneering technologies like UWB and integrating with Matter, ULTRALOQ reaffirms its leadership in the smart home industry.”

These new smart locks embody ULTRALOQ's commitment to convenience and security, making modern home living more accessible and efficient.

item.title: The Garmin Instinct 3 just launched at CES and it’s a rugged and affordable rival to the Fenix 8 - Tom's Guide
item.description:
Garmin Launches Instinct 3: Affordable Rival to Fenix 8

Publication Date: CES 2025

Source: Tom's Guide

The Garmin Instinct 3 smartwatch range has been launched at CES 2025, introducing features like an AMOLED display, solar charging, and a rugged design aimed at being a more affordable option compared to the Fenix 8.

  • Instinct 3 features an AMOLED display for the first time.
  • Includes new solar-charging model for unlimited battery life in sunlight.
  • Affordably priced Instinct E starts at $299, with other models at $399 and $449.
  • Equipped with a built-in flashlight and rugged designs available in Neotropic and Electric Lime.
  • Tested to military standard for durability and water resistance up to 10 ATM.
  • Dual-band GPS for enhanced outdoor tracking accuracy.
  • All models include health monitoring and smart features such as NFC payments.
"The Instinct 3 is likely to draw some customers away from the flagship Fenix 8, which is much more expensive."

This launch reflects Garmin's commitment to providing robust smartwatches that meet various consumer needs at competitive price points.

item.title: India's Squad For England ODIs: Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma's Future Confirmed In Report Amid Rumours - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Kohli and Rohit Confirmed for England ODIs Amid Selection Rumors

Publication Date: June 29, 2024

Source: NDTV Sports

Despite uncertainties surrounding their Test futures, Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma have been confirmed for India's upcoming ODI series against England, as they remain vital for the team's performance. This news follows claims that the selection committee might exclude them, highlighting the ongoing discussions around player position and workload.

  • Kohli and Rohit confirmed for the ODI series against England starting February 6.
  • Jasprit Bumrah's participation is uncertain due to back issues.
  • The series is crucial as it precedes the ICC Champions Trophy later in February.
  • Full schedule: 1st ODI on February 6 in Nagpur, 2nd ODI on February 9 in Cuttack, 3rd ODI on February 12 in Ahmedabad.
“His workload remains of utmost importance for the teams.”

The confirmation of Kohli and Rohit reinforces their significance in the ODI format, while questions linger about Bumrah's health as the team prepares for critical upcoming matches.
